definition: to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend
to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt

sentences.english: The higher the volume fraction, the lower the proportion of yield strain is.
sentences.chinese: 骨小梁的體積比越高，達到降伏應變的比例就越小。

sentences.english: My love looks fresh, and death to me subscribes.
sentences.chinese: 我的愛面貌一新，而死神降伏。

sentences.english: He who uses this sword can overwhelm marquis and rule all countries.
sentences.chinese: 使用此劍者可以降伏諸候，統御天下。

sentences.english: It improves the flatness and suppresses the yield point elongation.
sentences.chinese: 它改良平整度而且鎮壓降伏點伸長。
他以祈禱來降伏了對手。

sentences.english: The ability to subdue the enemy without battle is a reflection of the ultimate supreme strategy.
sentences.chinese: 只有不用戰鬥而使敵方降伏，纔是最高明的。

sentences.english: The temple is the symbolic architecture of this significant historic event of annihilation of the red-browed peasant insurrection.
sentences.chinese: 該廟是降伏赤眉軍這一重大歷史事件的標誌性建築。

definition: to subdue/to force to capitulate/to reduce to submission/to soothe
to overawe/to be scared into submission
to compel sb to obey/to force into submission/to subjugate
to surrender and pay allegiance to
